credit_line: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
title: Wall Decoration for the Drawing Room of the Palace of Caserta
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee, Cambridge, MA
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and gouache, watercolor on off-white laid paper
description: Divided into three panels. In front of the dado of the central one stands a console table. Above it is a mirror with a candle bracket with four candles at either side. On top is a panel with a Chinese scene.  The lateral panels are intended to have a dado and a rectangularly framed oblong Chinese representation, country scenes at left, worship of God at right. Above is the lower part of the enablature.
name: Drawing
